page.title: 01THE HAREFIELD AREA-GENERAL
page.content: This area offers a unique opportunity to see the effects of the spread of urban land uses in a rural setting on the edge of Greater London.The village of Harefield was never really made part of the expanding railway system of the area and has thus retained its rural identity. It is on a scarp over- looking the Colne valley and is surrounded by two major kinds of farm- scape - intensively managed grassland and areas of rough grazing.To the edges of the area, woodlands with public access are to be found.The underlying rock is mainly chalk over- lain by gravels and sand.The farming is thus of a mixed nature designed to maximize the agricultural potential of the area.
